sorcer.core.provider

Class ServiceTasker

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.core.provider.ServiceProvider
      • sorcer.core.provider.ServiceTasker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DestroyAdmin, LifeCycle, Remote, EventListener, Administrable, JoinAdmin, RemoteMethodControl, ProxyAccessor, ReferentUuid, ServiceIDListener, ServerProxyTrust, AdministratableProvider, ContextManagement, Provider, Outer, Partner, Partnership, RemoteContextManagement, Executor, Identifiable, Monitorable, Service, Tasker

    public class ServiceTasker
extends ServiceProvider
implements Tasker, Executor, Remote
    A ServiceTasker is a service coordinating execution of all methods as specified by signatures associated with the instance of service Task and control flow exertion of task type.

      • execute

        public ServiceExertion execute(Exertion task,
                      Transaction transaction)
                        throws TransactionException,
                               ExertionException
        A generic service request as specified by an exertion - a generic service message. It can be carried out dynamically and indirectly by any Service peer and directly by a Service matching the exertion's method Signature.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Executor
        Parameters:
        task - an input exertion
        transaction - The transaction (if any) under which to provide service.
        Returns:
        a resulting exertion
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if a transaction error occurs
        ExertionException - if an exertion invocation failed for any reason

      • isAuthorized

        public boolean isAuthorized(Subject subject,
                   Signature signature)
        Returns true if the subject is authorized to execute the exertion.
        Specified by:
        isAuthorized in interface Executor
        Parameters:
        subject - subject invoking the exertion
        signature - an service reference
        Returns:
        true if authorized, otherwise false
